com.softwareag.wx.is.config.file

Class ConfigFileList

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • java.util.Vector<ConfigFile>
          • com.softwareag.wx.is.config.file.ConfigFileList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<ConfigFile>, java.util.Collection<ConfigFile>, java.util.List<ConfigFile>, java.util.RandomAccess

    public class ConfigFileList
extends java.util.Vector<ConfigFile>
    Representation of list of configuration files. All functionality to deal with a list of configuration is maintained in this class:
    • Hold all files of a package after loading
    • Get sub-set of file by filtering for various criteria
    • Multiple filter operations can be chained to e.g. get all files stored outside the package that are loaded globally
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • addFile

        public void addFile(ConfigFile cfgFile,
                    boolean isActive)
        Add config file to list. If the file cannot be found, it will still be added and an errror be looged
        Parameters:
        cfgFile - File to be added
        isActive - Flag to indicate whether the file should be added as active or not, if it is found. If the file does not exist, it will set to inactive anyway

      • addFile

        public void addFile(ConfigFile cfgFile,
                    boolean isActive,
                    boolean logFileNotFound)

      • addFile

        public void addFile(ConfigFile cfgFile,
                    boolean isActive,
                    boolean logFileNotFound,
                    boolean addIfFileMissing)
        Add config file to list
        Parameters:
        cfgFile - File to be added
        isActive - Flag to indicate whether the file should be added as active or not, if it is found. If the file does not exist, it will set to inactive anyway
        logFileNotFound - Should a message be written to the log, if the file cannot be found?
        addIfFileMissing - Should the file be added even if it is missing?

      • deleteFile

        public void deleteFile(ConfigFile cfgFile)
        Remove file from list and physically delete it from disk
        Parameters:
        cfgFile - Configuration file to remove and delete
